repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body: I'm working on supporting `dict.setdefault` in Limited API mode, which means both poking at `__Pyx_PyDict_SetDefault` and the code generation for CachedCFunctions. I tried to keep normal CPython non-Limited-API behavior the same.

comment_data.body: Instead of calling `EncodedString()` here and in the declaration generation, we should do it in Code.py, `inject_unbound_methods()`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2685,7 +2685,15 @@ def generate_module_state_traverse(self, env, code):
             Naming.fusedfunction_type_cname)
         code.putln('#endif')
 
-    def generate_module_init_func(self, imported_modules, env, code):
+    def generate_cached_methods_initializers(self, globalstate, code):
+        code.putln("#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API")
+        for (type_cname, method_name), cname in sorted(globalstate.cached_cmethods.items()):
+            method_name_cname = globalstate.get_interned_identifier(EncodedString(method_name)).cname

comment_data.body:
The `method_name` is a global constant, not owned by the cached function. It must not be decrefed here, nor visited in `tp_traverse()`.

The `type` is also not currently ref-counted but assumed to be static. Maybe it should be increfed on the initial assignment, and then also integrated into the cleanup function (`ModuleNode.generate_module_cleanup_func()`).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1462,18 +1462,38 @@ def generate_cached_methods_decls(self):
         decl = self.parts['decls']
         init = self.parts['init_globals']
         cnames = []
+
+        decl.putln("#if !CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API")
+        init.putln("#if !CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API")
+        mod_global = Naming.modulestateglobal_cname
+        mod = self.parts['module_state']
+        mod_clear = self.parts['module_state_clear']
+        mod_define = self.parts['module_state_defines']
+        mod_traverse = self.parts['module_state_traverse']
         for (type_cname, method_name), cname in sorted(self.cached_cmethods.items()):
             cnames.append(cname)
             method_name_cname = self.get_interned_identifier(StringEncoding.EncodedString(method_name)).cname
+            # Non-Limited API
             decl.putln('static __Pyx_CachedCFunction %s = {0, 0, 0, 0, 0};' % (
                 cname))
             # split type reference storage as it might not be static
-            init.putln('%s.type = (PyObject*)&%s;' % (
-                cname, type_cname))
+            init.putln('%s.type = (PyObject*)&%s;' % (cname, type_cname))
             # method name string isn't static in limited api
-            init.putln('%s.method_name = &%s;' % (
-                cname, method_name_cname))
-
+            init.putln('%s.method_name = &%s;' % (cname, method_name_cname))
+
+            # Limited API
+            mod.putln("__Pyx_CachedCFunction %s;" % cname)
+            mod_clear.putln("Py_CLEAR(clear_module_state->%s.type);" % cname)
+            mod_clear.putln("Py_CLEAR(clear_module_state->%s.method);" % cname)
+            mod_clear.putln("Py_CLEAR(*(clear_module_state->%s.method_name));" % cname)

comment_data.body: I initially tried to do it all in Code.py but found that at that stage in compilation nothing had yet been written to the `init_module` part of globalstate. So I moved the relevant bits here :|
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2685,7 +2685,15 @@ def generate_module_state_traverse(self, env, code):
             Naming.fusedfunction_type_cname)
         code.putln('#endif')
 
-    def generate_module_init_func(self, imported_modules, env, code):
+    def generate_cached_methods_initializers(self, globalstate, code):
+        code.putln("#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API")
+        for (type_cname, method_name), cname in sorted(globalstate.cached_cmethods.items()):
+            method_name_cname = globalstate.get_interned_identifier(EncodedString(method_name)).cname

comment_data.body: I'll remove the visit/clear in favor of module clean up. Thanks!

comment_data.body: I meant only the call to `EncodedString()`. `method_name` should already be an `EncodedString` at this point and not need to become one.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2685,7 +2685,15 @@ def generate_module_state_traverse(self, env, code):
             Naming.fusedfunction_type_cname)
         code.putln('#endif')

+        for (type_cname, method_name), cname in sorted(globalstate.cached_cmethods.items()):
+            method_name_cname = globalstate.get_interned_identifier(EncodedString(method_name)).cname

comment_data.body: It looks like it is not an `EncodedString`, as I get a missing attribute `is_unicode` on compilation (it's a `str`)

comment_data.body:
Yes, but, as I wrote above:
> Instead of calling EncodedString() here and in the declaration generation, we should do it in Code.py, inject_unbound_methods().

commit.message:
Don't generate PyDict_SetDefault in Limited API mode

PyDict_SetDefault is not Limited API.

Existing tests. More is required before `dict.setdefault` works as a
CachedCFunction.

From Facebook diff D22170863

Cache CachedCFunctions in a way compliant with PEP-384

Store them on the module state when in Limited API mode.

From Facebook diff D22100849

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

title: [RFC] Support CachedCFunctions in Limited API mode
